current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: Providing for completion of the accelerated transition of United States combat and military and security operations to the Government of Afghanistan.

cosponsor.#tail: ) submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the

header.#text: Completion of accelerated transition of United States combat and military and security operations to the Government of Afghanistan

text.#text: It is the policy of the United States—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (NATO) member countries, and other allies in Afghanistan, the

shall complete the accelerated transition of United States military and security operations to the Government of Afghanistan and redeploy United States Armed Forces from Afghanistan (including operations involving military and security-related contractors) by not later than December 31, 2014; and

text.#text: that, in coordination with the Government of Afghanistan,
to pursue diplomatic efforts leading to a political settlement and reconciliation of the internal conflict in Afghanistan.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: determine the necessity to maintain United States troops in Afghanistan to carry out missions after December 31, 2014, any such presence and missions should be authorized by a separate vote of

text.#text: It is the sense of the
Nothing in this section shall be construed as limiting or prohibiting any authority of the
modify the military strategy, tactics, and operations of United States Armed Forces as such Armed Forces redeploy from Afghanistan;
attack al Qaeda forces wherever such forces are located;
provide financial support and equipment to the Government of Afghanistan for the training and supply of Afghanistan military and security forces;
gather, provide, and share intelligence with United States allies operating in Afghanistan and Pakistan; or
provide security after December 31, 2014, to United States facilities or diplomatic personnel located in Afghanistan.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and President of Afghanistan  Hamid Karzai: Now, therefore, be it
